DataElement.preferredName: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Other Timepoint Assessment Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other reason LVEF was assessed at a different time point.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction Other Timepoint Physical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an assessment of the left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF; the measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction; with each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber) at a different timepoint (a specific point in the time continuum established relative to an event).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia)

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field to specify the assessment performed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.
